A recruiter just called job seekers “stubborn narcissists” for having boundaries… so let’s translate that real quick.

In this video, we break down why refusing unpaid interview projects, not worshipping Workday applications, knowing your salary floor, skipping LinkedIn theater, and not self-betraying your standards is not narcissism — it’s self-respect.

Somehow, every time workers don’t comply with broken hiring rituals, they get labeled as “difficult,” “entitled,” or “the problem.” Funny how dignity suddenly becomes a persona
title: RECRUITER BLAMES EMPLOYEES FOR BEING UNEMPLOYED
